keywords: convenience@serve with salad for complete meal
subtitle: A great way of using minced turkey.This quiche is good for a light lunch or served cold in a picnic.

method.text: Sift flour and salt together. Rub in the butter until it resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add enough cold water to make a soft, but not sticky, dough.
Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface and use to line a 20 cm round flan tin or dish. Chill for 30 min while preparing the filling.

Heat the oil and gently cook the turkey for 5 min, stirring frequently. Add the mushrooms and continue cooking for 5 min, stirring well. Lift out of the pan with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper.
Bake the pastry case for 15 min, or until firm and very pale golden. Remove from oven. Reduce oven temperature to 150°C.

Spoon the turkey, mushrooms and sweetcorn into the pastry case. Beat the eggs together. Then add the milk and cream. Season to taste. Spoon over the turkey mixture and top with the cheese. If it seems as though you have a little too much custard mixture, hold some back and add after cooking for 10 min, when the filling tends to sink.
Bake for 45 min, or until the filling is firm and pale golden. Serve hot or cold in slices.

title: Turkey quiche
